definition:
To inclose for mowing; to set aside for grass. "A ground . . . hained in." Holland.

To inclose for mowing; to set aside for grass. "A ground . . . hained in."  Holland. HAIN'T Hain't  . A contraction of have not or has not; as, I hain't, he hain't, we hain't. [Colloq. or illiterate speech.] [Written also han't.]
